short_description: Heliogen is a startup that wants to “replace fuels with sunlight.” And the Bill Gates-backed solar startup, which has flown under the radar until today, has made a major green-energy breakthrough for heavy industry. Heliogen “has created the world’s first technology that can commercially replace fuels with carbon-free, ultra-high temperature heat from the sun.”

title: Ford Mustang Mach E will be immediately profitable, says Ford CEO
short_description: Ford’s newly revealed Mustang Mach E will start producing profit “on vehicle number one,” said Ford CEO Jim Hackett in an interview with Bloomberg after Ford’s Sunday Mach E reveal event.

title: VW adds production of ID.3 electric car to another factory in Germany
short_description: Volkswagen announced that the ID.3, its newest electric car, will also be assembled at their Gläserne Manufaktur factory in Dresden – its second factory in Germany to produce the vehicle.

title: Turboant X7 electric scooter review: 18 MPH for $399 with removable battery
short_description: While we’ve tested a pile of electric scooters here at Electrek, we rarely see any with removable batteries. But that’s exactly what the Turboant X7 electric scooter offers, along with some nice features and specs too. And it packages it all together for an affordable price of $399 (currently marked down from $599 for their November sale).What’s not to like?!

title: Watch Tesla retrofit Model X with new Full Self-Driving Computer
short_description: Tesla has slowly started its massive retrofit program to install its new Full Self-Driving (FSD) Computer in older vehicles, and an owner made a video about the process.

title: Onpark Find 3 is an ideal electric skateboard for inexperienced riders
short_description: I’m relatively new to the skateboard world, and I am indeed new to the electric skateboard world. A week or so ago, I got an advanced look at the Onpark Find 3. It includes dual brushless hub motors and can get up to 31 mph with 23 miles range on a single battery. It’s currently on Kickstarter, but I can confirm that it’s a real product, so I am excited to recap my experience.

title: Tesla and EV companies join fight against Trump admin over California’s clean air program
short_description: Tesla and other EV companies have joined the fight against the Trump administration’s effort to prevent California from implementing its own clean air program.

title: Tesla is expanding its ‘world’s largest battery’ project by 50%
short_description: Tesla’s battery project in Australia with Neoen became “the world’s largest battery” when it was completed two years ago.Now it has been so successful that they are expanding it by 50%.

title: Automobili Pininfarina will build a full line of electric cars
short_description: Automobili Pininfarina has announced plans for a future electric vehicle platform through a collaboration with Bosch, who make EV motors and charging equipment, and Benteler, a German holding company.They’ve also stated intent to debut a new electric design concept, which they’re dubbing the “PURA Vision,” sometime next year.

title: Canoo is first EV company to rethink electric cars for new era of mobility
short_description: Tesla radically transformed the auto industry by showing that EVs can be cool cars. But that notion is so 2012. While legacy automakers are just catching up to that idea (see: Mach-E), the next great innovation in electric mobility acknowledges that many urban dwellers don’t give a damn about owning a car at all. They want access without the hassle and expense of ownership. Canoo is the first EV company that fully understands the change.

title: BYTON gets California license to become an automotive retailer
short_description: BYTON, the Chinese EV maker, today announced that it has received a distributor license from the state of California. That means Byton will be a retail entity.

title: VW says ID.3 electric car is 40% cheaper to build than e-Golf
short_description: VW’s next-generation MEB electric platform is apparently delivering some significant cost reductions. VW CEO Herbert Diess says the first vehicle on the platform, the ID.3 electric car is 40% cheaper to build than the e-Golf.

title: Ford launches reservation website for new Mustang Mach E for $500
short_description: Ford has launched its ‘reservation website’ for the new Mustang Mach E. Prospective buyers can reserve the vehicle for a $500 refundable deposit.

title: Tesla Supercharger station caught on fire while ~13 gas stations had fires
short_description: A Tesla Supercharger station located at a Wawa convenience store in New Jersey caught on fire yesterday. The cause of the fire is currently unknown and Tesla is reportedly investigating the situation.

title: Ford Mustang Mach-E home charging: First look, on par with Tesla
short_description: Last month we reviewed the portable charging cords OEMs provide with their North American electric vehicles, and the results were wild.  We gave Tesla’s Gen2 UMC an A+, Audi an A, Nissan a B, Hyundai a D, GM a D-, BMW an F, and Jaguar an F-. Now we have our first look and some exclusive details about what Ford is calling simply the “Ford Mobile Charger”. Based on what we know so far, we can confidently predict an A rating, but probably an A+, and we may have to level down all the other OEMs besides Tesla. And Ford is including a couple of extras that Tesla doesn’t.

title: Tesla’s efficiency is improving 3% a year – increasing already impressive lead
short_description: Tesla’s latest updates show that it is improving its efficiency by 3% a year, which is increasing its already impressive lead over the rest of the automotive industry.

title: BMW i4: more details about electric sedan revealed
short_description: The BMW i4 is a next-generation all-electric sedan coming in 2021 and today, the German automaker has revealed more details about EV, including power, charging capacity and more.

title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is ‘excited’ for Ford Mustang Mach E, says should encourage other automakers
short_description: Much has been said about how Ford is going after Tesla with the launch of the Mustang Mach E, but Tesla CEO Elon Musk seems to be OK with it as he is ‘excited’ for the launch of the electric car and even added that it should encourage other automakers to go electric.

title: Exclusive: Bill Ford at Mustang Mach-E unveil admits being on Tesla’s turf
short_description: Minutes after the official unveiling of the Ford Mustang Mach-E, we jumped into the press scrum surrounding Bill Ford. Electrek asked Ford’s chairman, and Henry Ford’s great-grandson, if he knew the introduction was taking place one block from Tesla’s design center. “That’s a coincidence,” he said. And then he flashed a big smile.

title: Great artists steal: Why Ford’s Mustang Mach E was inspired by Tesla in all the right ways
short_description: Ford’s Mustang Mach E electric crossover is a big deal for the auto industry. There’s no denying that an iconic brand like the Ford Mustang getting rebuilt from the ground up with a compelling electric makeover is a historic moment in the movement away from ICE vehicles.But how we got to this point is just as important as this vehicle. And what I’ve found out after a few weeks of Ford interviews and research is that much of this Mach E Mustang was inspired by Tesla.

title: Unveiled: Ford Mustang Mach-E is first meat-and-potatoes EV for American heartland
short_description: The massive global transition to electric vehicles entered a new phase 30 minutes ago. That’s when Ford unveiled its Mustang Mach-E all-electric SUV. The significance of the moment has little to do with a high-tech breakthrough or stroke of innovation. That was already achieved by a pioneering Silicon Valley EV company. What happened in Los Angeles tonight was a cultural leap of EV technology from early-adopting, high-tech elite drivers – to the heart of America. The big shift comes down to one word: Mustang.

title: Ford Mustang Mach E – first official video footage (Update: first ride video!)
short_description: Ford has just unveiled the Mustang Mach E at a private event at the LA Auto Show.  Electrek is on the scene and will be bringing you updates in our Ford Mustang Mach E livestream news hub post.In addition to the livestream and media drives/information we’ve been given, Ford has released some footage of the vehicle and we’ve assembled a YouTube video running down the key points of the electric crossover SUV.

title: Ford Mustang Mach E livestream news hub: watch here at 5:50pm PST tonight
short_description: Ford’s Mustang Mach E electric crossover SUV gets unveiled tonight in Los Angeles, in advance of the LA Auto Show.  Electrek is at the event and will bring you full coverage of everything you need to know about the car here.

title: Tesla Model 3 0-60mph times, then and now, all trims compared
short_description: Yesterday we reported that the (now discontinued) Mid-Range Model 3 has seen a performance bump from 5.6s to 4.9s since its debut. Many of you naturally asked about the other trims, so here you go! We break down all the trims as they were advertised at their debut, how they’re currently advertised on Tesla’s website as of today, November 17, and what drivers are reporting with the 2019.36.x software update which began deployment on November 8, 2019. Note that 2019.36.x was the second power boost for all Model 3s, there was an earlier over-the-air power boost in March 2019.

title: 2019 LA Auto Show Roundup: big Ford and Tesla EV reveals, startup news
short_description: The list of EVs getting unveiled in Los Angeles this week is not as long as in previous years. But the importance of those vehicles is extraordinary. The week starts with the wraps coming off the Ford Mustang Mach-E. And it ends, post-show, with the first look of the Tesla Cybertruck. It’s a big week for EVs. Here are a few of the highlights from the 2019 Los Angeles Auto Show.

title: Universal solar-charging canopy ready for electric scooters and e-bikes
short_description: Every now and again my news feed pushes something weird my way, and I’m always glad when it does. Today’s weird bit of news is a cool new product from a company called Motosola. They have developed a solar charging sun canopy for electric scooters that looks like it can actually put a significant amount of charge back into a vehicle.

title: California will no longer buy cars made by automakers aligned with Trump against clean air
short_description: The California state government has fired back against the Trump administration’s attempt to destroy the state’s emission regulations and those of ZEV states. Gov. Gavin Newsom’s administration enacted a directive yesterday which would prevent agencies from buying most gas-powered sedans and any vehicles made by the few automakers siding with Trump’s “EPA”.

title: Climate Crisis Weekly: What would the world look like in 2030 if we stopped climate change? more
short_description: The World Economic Forum: What if we actually got things right with fixing climate change?Venice’s regional council floods for the first time — right after it voted against climate-crisis action.Greta Thunberg sails back to Europe on a catamaran, and leaves the US with some parting advice.Scientists are trying to study — and save — the Amazon rainforest, but the Brazilian government is trying to thwart them.And more…

title: Rivian R1T electric pickup traveled 314 miles on a charge, releases video off-roading
short_description: Rivian has released new information on its test program for the R1T electric pickup truck and released a video of a R1T pickup prototype off-roading.

title: Tesla Model 3 Mid-range now goes 0-60mph in 4.9s, down from 5.6 at launch
short_description: Earlier this week we reported that the Model 3 Performance’s 0-60 mph acceleration dipped below 3 seconds – a 2.99 recorded by DragTimes – after a software update CEO Elon Musk announced during the Q3 Tesla earnings call.Now Model 3 Mid-range owners, aka The Goldilocks Crew, can rejoice as well: the ‘just right’ trim clocks 0-60mph in under 5 seconds. Youtuber nukem384 recorded a time of 4.9s, compared to a 5.6s time when the Mid-range was introduced just over a year ago.

title: CoMotion LA Micromobility event vehicle roundup: fun ways to get around the city
short_description: We had the pleasure of attending CoMotion LA: a fantastic event for transportation innovators, delegates, municipalities, vendors, and lawmakers to all connect and collaborate.With conferences and meetings occurring at every hour, we were on the exhibition floor to bring you the new, the exciting, the quirky, and the bold new vehicles coming to a neighborhood near you.

title: EGEB: As oil giant Aramco gears up for its IPO, the EU stops funding fossil fuels, more
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):The European Union will stop funding fossil fuels by the end of 2021.Oil giant Aramco gears up for its initial public offering.The first-ever hydrogen-powered train is coming to the US.Deputy Energy Secretary Dan Brouillette had his first US Senate energy secretary hearing yesterday.

title: Podcast: Tesla Gigafactory 4, Tesla CYBRTRK, Ford Mustang Mach E, and more
short_description: Sponsored by EV Items: Get 20% off EV Items Tesla accessories incl. Qi console charger, Interior LED Light Upgrade & more w/ code Electrek.This week on the Electrek Podcast, we discuss the most popular news in the world of sustainable transport and energy, including the Tesla Gigafactory 4 announcement in Germany, the Tesla CYBRTRK electric pickup, the Ford Mustang Mach E specs leak, and more.Support our show!https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2019/11/Electrek-11-15-2019.mp3

title: This 50 MPH police-edition electric bicycle could replace cop e-motorcycles
short_description: Electric motorcycles are increasingly entering police fleets for patrol use, but now we could be seeing electric bicycles entering the mix as well, thanks to the new Delfast Top Cop e-bike.

title: Tesla-Volkswagen partnership: VW CEO shuts down rumor
short_description: VW CEO has shut down the rumors of a collaboration between Tesla and Volkswagen after he was reported to be excited about an investment in the electric automaker.

title: Watch latest Rivian R1T electric pickup prototype spotted driving in Canada
short_description: A Rivian R1T electric pickup prototype was spotted driving around in Canada – giving a rare great look at the latest working prototype.

title: Electric vehicles still unavailable at most dealerships: Sierra Club report
short_description: In 2016, the Sierra Club published “Rev Up Electric Vehicles: Multi-State Study of the Electric Vehicle Shopping Experience.” Volunteers for the non-profit went undercover to document the experience of buying an EV. We covered it at the time, and it wasn’t a good look for legacy OEMs’ dealerships. Now, three years later and with the help of volunteers across America, the Sierra Club has published a follow-up, this time covering all fifty states, and the results still reflect very poorly on legacy auto dealerships. For starters, 74% of American auto dealerships still aren’t selling any electric vehicles. But the fault isn’t just on dealerships.

title: Electric scooters already seeing big discounts in early Black Friday deals
short_description: Electric scooters have become one of the most convenient forms of last-mile transportation in cities. Small, quick, and easy to fold away, they’ve complemented e-bikes as one of the fastest-growing forms of urban transportation.And with Black Friday deals starting earlier every year, now is already a great time to snag a new electric scooter for a deep discount. And while you’re preparing for Black Friday, be sure to visit our deals site 9to5Toys for all the latest Black Friday deals!

title: Tesla-inspired EV maker Xpeng secures $400 million investment
short_description: Xpeng is one of the most controversial EV startups, and yet it’s one of the most successful. The openly Tesla-inspired EV maker announced that it secured a $400 million investment.

title: Sur Ron clarifies Segway electric dirt bike, promises 2020 surprises
short_description: Earlier this month, we broke the news that Segway was entering the electric powersports market with the brand’s first electric dirt bike.

title: Lyft makes 200 electric cars available to drivers in Denver
short_description: Lyft wants all its rides to become powered by electricity, and in order to make it happen, they have to make it easier for their drivers to drive electric.This week, they announced the deployment of 200 electric cars available to drivers in Denver.

title: Tesla Model Y vs. Ford Mustang Mach-E specs comparison
short_description: Ford has been positioning its Mustang Mach-E, its first next-gen all-electric vehicle, against the Tesla Model Y electric crossover.Now that the specs of the Mach-E have leaked, we can make a quick specs comparison with the Model Y.

title: Ford Mustang Mach E specs leaked, $36-53k*, 230-300mi, 3-6sec 0-60
short_description: Pricing, specs and configurations of Ford’s upcoming Mustang Mach E electric SUV have leaked just days ahead of Ford’s November 17 Mach E launch.  The information was all posted to Ford’s website, and looks like it includes just about everything there is to know about the car.

title: The European Union will stop fossil-fuel funding by the end of 2021
short_description: In a groundbreaking triumph for green energy, the European Investment Bank (EIB), the European Union’s financing department, will cease funding for nearly all fossil-fuel projects by the end of 2021.

title: Tesla CYBRTRK event invites sent out, look at those lights
short_description: Just moments after discovering that Tesla trademarked the CYBERTRK name, we now have more Cybertruck news.You know the Tesla CYBRTRK event is real when the invites come out. (Full invite is below.) See if you can determine what those headlights mean, along with some new design clues buried in the invite.

title: Tesla files for CYBRTRK, Cybertruck trademarks in advance of Nov 21 pickup truck reveal
short_description: The highly-anticipated Tesla pickup truck will be unveiled on November 21, just a week from now. In advance of this unveiling, Tesla has filed for a trademark with some non-standard spelling. It looks like they will be stylizing the name of the truck as: “CYBRTRK.”Update: Tesla has sent out invites to the Cybrtrk event.

title: Buying a Polestar EV happens in gallery spaces with fixed prices and a giant tabletop screen
short_description: It’s been three weeks since the opening of the world’s first so-called Polestar Space, where the Swedish brand will sell electric performance vehicles. A couple of new (rough) videos like this one reveal the customer experience, which Polestar CEO Thomas Ingenlath explained a few weeks ago.

title: Tesla Model 3 and Model S regain Consumer Reports recommendation for reliability
short_description: Tesla’s Model 3 and Model S have both regained official recommendation from Consumer Reports as part of their latest reliability survey.

title: EGEB: Kenyan coal project near UNESCO World Heritage site loses big-bank backing, more
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):African Development Bank pulls out of an eastern Kenyan coal plant project at Lamu.Seoul is putting solar on all public buildings and 1 million homes.German steel giant Thyssenkrupp uses hydrogen as a step toward its net-zero-by-2050 pledge.An earthquake in France earlier this week prolongs the shutdown of nuclear reactors until December.

title: Believe it or not, electric bikes give as much exercise as pedal bikes
short_description: A new study out of Brigham Young University has found that despite popular belief, electric bicycle riders get nearly as much exercise as pedal bike riders.

title: Tesla Model 3 Performance’s 0-60 mph acceleration dips below 3 seconds after software update
short_description: Tesla Model 3 Performance vehicles are getting faster 0-60 mph acceleration through the latest power optimization software update.There are now reports that the Model 3 Performance’s 0-60 mph time has dipped below the 3-second mark.

title: New Jersey legislature debates electric vehicle tax (Updated)
short_description: On the heel of Pennsylvania’s proposed $250 yearly electric vehicle tax, the New Jersey Senate Transportation Committee this afternoon is considering S.4090, a bill to establish a commission to design its own electric vehicle tax. The bill was introduced by state senators Patrick J. Diegnan Jr., chair of the Senate Transportation Committee, and Linda R. Greenstein, assistant majority leader. Both are Democrats, and both are apparently receptive to the fossil fuel industry’s push for special taxes on electric vehicles. Update: the discussion begins at the 11:20 minute mark here. Not good. Eric Blomgren of the New Jersey Gasoline & Convenience Store Association and Michael Egenton of the New Jersey Chamber of Commerce testify, pushing hard for the tax and slowing EV adoption. Jeff Tittel, Director of New Jersey Sierra Club, appears alone to defend EV drivers. He’s outnumbered and the bill continues its menacing march forward.

title: #ToyotaTrump boycott gains momentum, loyal Toyota customers in revolt
short_description: Two weeks ago, Toyota sided with the Trump administration’s bid to bar California from setting its own fuel-efficiency and zero-emission rules. The next day, on Oct. 29, former U.S. Labor Secretary Robert Reich, tweeted, “Toyota, goodbye. The environmental goodwill you’ve built by pioneering hybrid cars has vanished in your choice of Trump over California. #toyotatrump.” And the Toyota-Trump boycott was started.

title: VW is planning to produce ‘up to 1.4 million electric drives’ that fit in a gym bag
short_description: With the start of ID.3 production, VW is revealing more details about its MEB electric motor. It is planning to produce ‘up to 1.4 million electric drives’ and it can fit in a gym bag.

title: CityRider electric scooter review: 18 mph with a wooden deck and blinkers!
short_description: The CityRider electric scooter from Fluidfreeride is a fast, fun, and attractive electric scooter. And the fact that it combines old-school charm with modern tech makes it one of the best budget electric scooters on the market.

title: Tesla has to cut down forest to build Gigafactory 4, will plant 3x as many trees
short_description: Tesla is going to have to cut down part of a forest near Berlin in order to build Gigafactory 4. BMW ran into some similar issues when it tried to do the same almost two decades ago.Interestingly, the announcement comes just as Tesla CEO Elon Musk helped plant 1 million trees.

title: Ford’s Mustang Mach-E: 55 years on, the great American pony car goes electric
short_description: It is hard to imagine a bigger milestone in the transition away from internal combustion engines than Ford’s iconic Mustang going electric. The Mustang debuted in late 1964 and has symbolized the American sports car, speed, and the pleasure of the open road in the 55 years since. Sure, in recent years, the Mustang might have grown a little stale with its loud, polluting combustion engines that don’t come close to the performance of electric motors from Tesla and others.But today Ford made it official, the Mustang is going electric with the “Mach-E” nameplate.

title: Tesla hater tries to run couple off the road in strange incident caught on video
short_description: A Tesla hater attempted to run a couple off the road in their Tesla in another strange electric vehicle hating incident caught on video.

title: Tesla has a new big Megapack project to replace a gas peaker plant
short_description: Tesla is going to deploy its new energy storage product, the Megapack, in a new big project to replace a gas peaker plant in Southern California.

title: LA adds hundreds of EV chargers to streetlights, giving renters a place to plug in
short_description: The City of Los Angeles has installed EV charging stations directly attached to more than 130 streetlight poles. Hundreds more are planned. The streamlined solution to electric-car charging has been deployed in major European cities but not so much yet in America. But it makes total sense for a city like LA that has a large population of EV drivers, many who don’t have the ability to charge at home.

title: EGEB: Trump’s firm loses to Scottish wind farm, EVs are being undercut by SUVs, more
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):Donald Trump’s firm will pay the Scottish government £225,000 in legal fees after it’s defeated by an offshore wind farm.EV time-varying rates incentivize off-peak charging, finds new SEPA study.IEA: Growth of SUVs kills eco-benefits from rise of electric carsAccelerator GCxN has announced its second cohort of five companies addressing utility grid and EV charging issues.

title: Lucid Motors finally starts construction at EV factory after years of delays
short_description: Lucid Motors is finally starting construction at its electric vehicle factory in Arizona after years of delays due to difficulties raising capital.

title: IEA: Growth of SUVs kills eco-benefits from rise of electric cars
short_description: The International Energy Agency (IEA) released its annual report yesterday. The Paris-based intergovernmental organization points to electric vehicles as instrumental in curbing global emissions. Unfortunately, those gains are being fundamentally undercut by the dramatic rise in SUVs.

title: Tesla (TSLA) surpasses Daimler in market value as it invests in German automaker’s backyard
short_description: Tesla’s (TSLA) market capitalization has now surpassed Daimler’s again as the electric automaker announces a big investment in the German automotive industry’s backyard.

title: US and China agree to end Trump tariffs on e-bikes, set to reduce prices
short_description: In a move that nearly the entire US electric bicycle industry is cheering, a new agreement between the US and China is set to end the electric bicycle trade war.We’re already seeing big Black Friday discounts on electric bikes, and this move could keep the low e-bike prices coming.

title: Tesla is upgrading its largest Supercharger station with new V3 technology
short_description: Tesla’s Supercharger V3 rollout is starting to heat up with a lot of new large stations under way, and we now learn that Tesla is updating its largest Supercharger station in the US with new V3 technology.

title: Tesla obtains manufacturing license for Gigafactory 3 — production is imminent
short_description: Tesla has finally obtained its manufacturing license to start production at Gigafactory 3 in Shanghai — indicating that production is imminent at the new factory.

title: Horwin’s 65 mph gear-shifting electric motorcycles actually look pretty rad
short_description: Electrek caught up with Horwin at the EICMA 2019 Milan Motorcycle Show this year to check out its new line of electric motorcycles. The company debuted the Horwin CR6 and Horwin CR6 Pro, the latter of which features a manual gear box.

title: Tesla Semi gets a Chinese clone and ‘Cybertruck’ to go with it
short_description: If imitation is the sincerest form of flattery, then Tesla should be flattered that Neuron EV, a Chinese-backed EV startup, copied the design of the Tesla Semi for their own electric semi-truck.They have also made an electric pickup to ride the hype of the Tesla Cybertruck.

title: Tesla to focus on Model Y, batteries, and powertrains at Gigafactory 4 in Europe
short_description: Tesla is going to focus on Model Y production at its newly confirmed Gigiafactory 4 to be built in the Berlin area, and they will also produce batteries and powertrains at the new European factory.

title: VW breaks ground on massive Tennessee EV plant, dubbed a “magic moment” by CEO
short_description: Volkswagen breaks ground Wednesday on its Tennessee plant that will produce two battery-powered cars, according to Reuters. Plans for the $800 million investment in the Chattanooga plant were first announced in January. The ground-breaking shows that Volkswagen is intent on achieving its goal of producing 50 million electric cars in the next several years.

title: EGEB: Qantas pledges net zero by 2050, earthquake suspends French nuclear reactors, more
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):Qantas Airways will cut its carbon emissions to net zero by 2050 — good news among bad climate news.G20 countries get their report cards from Climate Transparency. Here’s the lowdown on transport.Three French nuclear reactors are suspended after a 5.1 magnitude earthquake.Sacramento Municipal Utility District wants to provide homeowners with centrally generated solar energy.

title: Elon Musk: Tesla is going to build Gigafactory 4 in ‘Berlin area’
short_description: Elon Musk has confirmed that Tesla is going to build Gigafactory 4, a new vehicle factory, in the ”Berlin area” as they start listing jobs for the new factory.

title: Kawasaki releases specs for first electric motorcycle, but they kind of suck
short_description: Kawasaki’s first electric motorcycle has been under development for around a decade. And today we finally got more information and some early specs for the Kawasaki electric motorcycle prototype.But the specs released by Kawasaki are shocking. And not in a good way.

title: California drops EV rebates for cars over $60k, plug-ins below 35 miles of EV range
short_description: Starting December 3, California EV buyers purchasing vehicles with a price exceeding $60,000 will not qualify for the state’s $2,500 clean-vehicle rebate. The change will eliminate rebates for the Audi e-tron and Jaguar i-Pace — as well as many models from BMW, Mercedes-Benz, and Tesla. Plug-in hybrids with less than 35 miles of all-electric range will also become ineligible.

title: Tesla ICEd by pickup truck gets satisfying justice as police lift it off with crane
short_description: A Tesla vehicle had difficulty charging because a pickup truck was icing, but it got satisfying justice when the police ended up lifting the pickup truck off the ground with a crane.

title: Green transport report card: which G20 countries are leading and lagging
short_description: Climate Transparency has released its 2019 Brown to Green Report. The report is “the world’s most comprehensive annual review of G20 countries’ climate action and their transition to a net zero emissions economy.” The bottom line: The G20 is not on track to meet Paris goals. But there are some positive trends in some of the world’s 20 biggest economies. And being that we’re Electrek, we’re going to take a quick look here at the report’s findings when it comes to transport.

title: Tesla is planning new monster Supercharger V3 station to connect LA and Phoenix
short_description: Tesla’s rollout of new Supercharger V3 stations has been slow, but it is about to ramp up – including with a large new 28-stall station to connect Los Angeles and Phoenix.

title: It turns out that this American-style cruiser electric motorcycle is legit
short_description: Last month I ran a story about the emergence of what was claimed to be the first American electric cruiser motorcycle, the Hadin Panther. After some digging around, I discovered that the company’s American-based claims were somewhat exaggerated, and I was unsure what to expect at the bike’s unveiling at this year’s EICMA Milan Motorcycle Show.But as it turned out, the company showed up with some legit motorcycles, and were able to get a bit closer to the bottom of this odd yet interesting story of the first “American-style” electric cruiser bike.

title: Electric boat with used Renault Zoe battery packs launches in Paris
short_description: An all-electric boat equipped with “second-life” Renault Zoe battery packs has launched as part of Seine Alliance’s fleet operating in Paris.

title: Tesla (TSLA) gets boost from Wall Street as shorts are short on arguments
short_description: Tesla’s stock (TSLA) is on another rally, and it is getting a boost from Wall Street analysts as the usual short arguments are starting to fade.

title: Xiaomi’s weird new $425 electric bike folds to the size of a sheet of paper
short_description: It’s smaller than an A3 size sheet of paper, which is equivalent to roughly two 8.5 x 11-inch sheets of standard printer paper. But any which way you slice it, Xiaomi’s new Himo H1 electric bike is pretty darn small.

title: Tesla Model X was set on fire by arsonist, owner says Tesla was targeted
short_description: A Tesla Model X was set on fire in Düsseldorf earlier this week, and the owner believes that the vandal was targeting his car because it is a Tesla.

title: Ottobike unveils impressive 75 MPH (120 km/h) electric dirt bike for 2020
short_description: We first caught up with Ottobike at the 2018 EICMA Milan Motorcycle Show where the team showed us their electric motorcycle offerings. This year we met with the team again to see their new models, including the hot new Ottobike MXR electric dirt bike.

title: Mercedes-Benz releases lifecycle environmental assessment of EQC electric SUV
short_description: Mercedes-Benz yesterday released an environmental report on its EQC electric vehicle. Much of the report focuses on its full life cycle of CO2 emissions, from the mining of raw materials to final disposal. Only about half of the vehicle’s impact occurs while on the road. The environmental report came two days after Mercedes-Benz launched the EQC in Beijing.

title: EGEB: JPMorgan Chase leads with the world’s largest bifacial solar rooftop — and lending to fossil-fuel companies, more
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):JPMorgan launches the world’s largest commercial installation of bifacial solar modules — and also leads in fossil-fuel lending.Energy CEOs voice defiance on efforts to reduce carbon emissions.Video: The top 15 largest oil-producing countries from 1966 to 2018.E&E News is publishing a multi-part series on “the promise and peril of EV infrastructure.”

title: Review: Backfire Ranger X2 all terrain electric skateboard – a thrill on wheels
short_description: What would happen if you combined the thrill of zooming along the pavement on an electric skateboard with the go-anywhere freedom of all-terrain vehicles? You’d end up with the Backfire Ranger X2 electric skateboard, and you’d be in for a serious treat!

title: Rivian’s quad-motor torque vectoring sets high bar for Tesla Cybertruck
short_description: Tesla’s Cybertruck gets revealed in 10 days. We know it will have incredible performance in a straight line, and that Elon will trumpet its zero-to-60 number. But a vehicle’s offroad capability is more about handling. Whether or not Tesla can steal electric-truck thunder back from Rivian will be based on a simple metric: how many motors are on board the Cybertruck.

title: Tesla Autopilot detects and avoids family of ducks caught on video, owner says
short_description: A Tesla owner claims that Tesla Autopilot detected and avoided a family of ducks in the middle of the road and the whole incident was caught on the TeslaCam.

title: Tesla unveils Model 3 made-in-China with media test drives
short_description: Tesla has unveiled its first Model 3 made-in-China at Gigafactory 3 in Shanghai and it has now even started to give media test drives of the vehicle ahead of the start of sales.

title: Watch how Tesla trains its neural networks for self-driving in 10 minutes
short_description: Andrej Karpathy, Tesla’s head of AI and computer vision, gave an interesting talk to get into how Tesla trains its neural networks for self-driving.It results in an interesting overview of the concept in about 10 minutes.

title: Tesla next-gen Roadster: a look at folding backseat based on diecast
short_description: We get a rare good look at the Tesla next-gen Roadster’s folding backseat through its new diecast model, which is based on the production CAD files — meaning it should be representative of what will get to production.

title: Watch Tesla’s new over-the-air performance update put to the test
short_description: Tesla recently increased vehicle performance by ~5% through an over-the-air update, and today we have a video confirming the improvement with some side-by-side testing.

title: Save money on e-bike batteries, motors, and more today on 11/11 shopping holiday
short_description: Each year on November 11, China celebrates a national holiday known as Singles Day. It began as a holiday for single people, but has morphed into the largest shopping holiday in the world. And if you know where to look, you can find amazing deals on all sorts of products from China.And fortunately for you, we’ve found the best e-bike-related deals and compiled them below.

title: Honda works on second EV, quits diesel, and puts hydrogen on hold
short_description: There’s no doubt that Honda fell behind on electric cars. Beat up the company as much as you like about its meager EV offerings to date. But also consider signs that the Japanese automaker is slowly correcting its course. In addition to introducing the small Honda E in Europe next year, Honda is working on a second EV for about 2022. Other small victories include quitting diesel, putting hydrogen indefinitely on hold, and agreeing with California’s emissions standards.

title: Tesla update forks features for Model 3s built pre/post April 2019
short_description: Last week we reported that the latest over-the-air Tesla software update improves driving visualization to detect and render traffic cones. Then on Thursday we also shared a video of a Tesla navigating its way through traffic cones, courtesy Tesla hacker @greentheonly. Now @greentheonly is reporting that the traffic cone feature is only being delivered to Tesla owners with the ‘Hardware 3’ chip (HW3). This is significant, as it’s the first time that software features (in this case, Auto Lane Change and Navigate-on-Autopilot) will be forked for Tesla drivers depending on when their Tesla was built.

title: GM releases perfect 200+mile range Crossover EV for US market…in China
short_description: GM announced two weeks ago that it would be supporting Donald Trump’s rollback of EV emissions standards by siding with the administration vs. California. You would think that GM – with its pioneering Bolt EV and “zero emissions future” initiatives – would support lowering emissions. But something has gone terribly wrong at GM over the past few years in EVs.The latest indication of this is an announcement that the company would be releasing a Menlo crossover EV – which would likely do well in a US market – in China alone.

title: This giant-wheeled electric scooter makes some bold self-driving claims
short_description: Recently it has felt like there’s a new scooter entering the market every other day. But today’s new entry, the Scooterson Rolley 2, bucks the small-wheeled trend and opts for a giant-wheeled seated scooter design. And its manufacturer is making some bold self-driving claims to boot.

title: Pedego Latch Review: The Traveler’s Safeguard
short_description: William Shatner will tell you that Pedego has been synonymous with electric beach cruisers for a long time. Their folding Pedego Latch model is unique enough for special attention, and similar enough to the “Pedego feel”. However, in one special aspect I believe outweighs its peers, both inside and outside Pedego’s lineup.

title: Get 20% off EV Items Tesla accessories incl. Qi console charger, Interior LED Light Upgrade & more
short_description: Thanks to our sponsor EV Items, you can get an exclusive 20% off any of its premium Tesla accessories now for a limited time with code Electrek at checkout (+ free shipping for orders over $50). You’ll also get a free Elon Musk Starman Air Freshener with every purchase. Some of our picks from the sale:Model 3 Qi Wireless Center Console Phone ChargerModel S and Model X Qi Wireless Phone Charger Center Console InsertPremium Interior Light Upgrade (Super Bright LED Bulbs)Head below for a look at what’s included:

title: Tesla Model 3: prepare for winter with tires, mats, and some tips
short_description: There’s a lot of talk about electric vehicles not being good in the winter, but that’s not true, especially with Tesla’s vehicles, like the Model 3. If you prepare right, you should have a great driving and ownership experience during the winter.Here are some tips and accessories that can help you prepare your Model 3 for the winter.

title: VOGE debuts ER 10 electric motorcycle – is this the ultimate 250cc replacer?
short_description: Despite the plethora of gas-powered motorcycles at VOGE’s booth at EICMA 2019, their new electric motorcycle received the most attention with a centerstage reveal. As the curtain was pulled away from the shiny new VOGE ER 10 electric motorcycle at the Milan Motorcycle Show, could another curtain be beginning to drop on 250cc-level gas motorcycles?

title: Climate Crisis Weekly: Virginians showed they care about climate change on voting day, more
short_description: Virginia Democrats campaigned on fighting the climate crisis and won.The official word[s] of the year for 2019? “Climate strike.”New Zealand passes a law that sets 2050 as its net zero target year.An offshore wind farm in Rhode Island proves to be a popular fishing spot.Spain will host the UN climate talks in December after Chile withdraws.And more…

title: Free electric motorcycle and scooter rides help solve cuban gas crisis
short_description: As Cuba suffers through a fuel shortage that is grinding conventional transportation to a halt, electric motorcycles known as motorinas have shown up in force to help Cubans get around.

title: EVs are not a problem during California fire season, they’re the friggin’ solution
short_description: Electric-car naysayers jump to the conclusion that California EV drivers were stranded during recent power outages. But Carleen Cullen, executive director of Cool the Earth, used juice from her two EVs to keep critical appliances running during fire season.

title: EGEB: Colorado can go zero-carbon with big savings, UK reducing heavy industry CO2, more
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):Analysis shows Colorado can go zero-carbon with big savings for Coloradans.UK to spend £315 million to reduce heavy industry emissions.Bipartisan US Senate Climate Solutions Caucus grows to 8 members.

title: Tesla breaks down range of Model 3 Performance with different wheels — surprising differences
short_description: With its new 2020 model year, Tesla is breaking down the range of Model 3 Performance with different wheels, and there are surprising differences with the different options.

title: Waymo’s Detroit plant goes online, a step toward reducing FCA into a hardware provider
short_description: John Krafcik, CEO of Waymo, last week said that its Detroit plant is now in operation. Waymo is busily outfitting fleets of Chrysler Pacifica plug-in hybrids with self-driving tech. It’s a big step toward realizing traditional automakers’ greatest fear: getting reduced to being just a hardware provider.

title: Podcast: Tesla Model 3 new efficiency king, new Model S/X battery pack, new Nürburgring record, and more
short_description: This week on the Electrek Podcast, we discuss the most popular news in the world of sustainable transport and energy, including the Tesla Model 3 becoming the new efficiency king, a new Model S/X battery pack coming, Tesla securing an unofficial new Nürburgring record, and more.Support our show!https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2019/11/Electrek-11-08-2019.mp3

title: VW starts pre-production at all-electric vehicle factory in China
short_description: VW announced that it already started pre-production at its all-electric vehicle factory in China, just a year after ground breaking at the new plant.

title: Tesla Model 3 and Model Y under consideration by police department
short_description: Electric vehicles and especially Tesla vehicles are now on the radar of police departments looking to update their fleet. The Tesla Model 3 is already being deployed and now even the Model Y is under consideration at a police department in Pennsylvania.All it takes is a test drive… and looking at the numbers.

title: 2020 Hyundai Ioniq Electric gets 170 miles EPA range with new battery, loses efficiency crown
short_description: The new 2020 Hyundai Ioniq Electric has received its official EPA rating with its new battery pack: 170 miles, but it lost the efficiency crown to the Tesla Model 3.

title: Elon Musk taunts Tesla short David Einhorn and makes him smart offer he can’t refuse
short_description: Elon Musk sent a public letter to David Einhorn, a famous hedge fund manager who has a big short position on Tesla, and he offered to meet him and have him visit Tesla — a smart move that Einhorn would have a tough time refusing.

title: Tesla Roadster 2 die cast 1:18 model goes on sale, look at that hatchback
short_description: Tesla may not have a solid delivery date for when it’s delivering its full-sized second generation Roadsters (currently 2021-ish), but the company today began selling a $250 1:18 scale model made from the same 3D CAD data as the real car. It is so detailed that we might be able to learn some new things about the full sized car here… like, look at that hatchback for instance…

title: Review: Taga family electric cargo bike is the ultimate kid-hauling e-bike
short_description: Just when I thought I’d ridden nearly every type of electric bicycle out there, along comes the Taga Family Electric Cargo Bike. Not only does it have a giant front trunk (an e-bike with a frunk?), but it also has two kids’ seats to carry the family around.

title: 2020 Tesla Model 3 beats Hyundai IONIQ to become most efficient EV produced
short_description: The 2020 EPA estimated ranges are out for both the Tesla Model 3 and Hyundai IONIQ, and we have a new champion of efficiency. Hint: It’s not the car that looks like a glorified Prius, it’s the full-featured sedan with a snappy 0-60 time…

title: Mercedes-Benz chief confirms all-electric G-Class wagon in the works
short_description: Ola Källenius, chairman of Daimler and head of Mercedes-Benz, confirmed today that the company will produce an all-electric version of the iconic G-Class wagon. Källenius made the commitment to the G-Class EV while speaking at Automobilwoche Kongress in Berlin.

title: Ford’s “Mustang-inspired” Mach E, Tesla Model Y competitor, spied in production form
short_description: The Mach E SUV, Ford’s hotly anticipated Tesla Model Y competitor, which debuts on November 17, has been spied in production form. The photos were posted in a thread on the Mach E forum (below), the burgeoning fan forum for Ford’s upcoming SUV.Mach E forum previously brought us what looked like close-to-production renders, and the new spy shots don’t look far off.

title: GM just sold its Lordstown plant to an EV startup affiliated with Workhorse
short_description: GM’s Lordstown, Ohio, plant has been sold to an EV startup, “Lordstown Motors Corp.,” which is affiliated with Workhorse Group, the company behind the Workhorse W-15 plug-in pickup truck.Workhorse shares no ownership with Lordstown Motors Corp., but the two companies are affiliated. They plan to share intellectual property, and Workhorse’s ex-CEO Steve Burns is now CEO of Lordstown Motors.

title: EV maker Byton will digitize the entire customer experience, including facial recognition in cars and dealerships
short_description: China-based Byton revealed its high-tech, all-electric M-Byte SUV nearly two years ago. We took our first ride a year later. Now, as the company moves toward sales in China in 2020, we spoke with Jose Guerrero, managing director of Byton Americas, to discuss its digital-first, go-to-market strategy in the US.

title: EGEB: Los Angeles approves largest solar and storage system in the US, more
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):Los Angeles has approved the largest solar and storage system in the US — enough for nearly 1 million residents.Italy is going to make climate-change study mandatory in state schools.A new report names the countries responsible for the most fossil-fuel emissions.

title: VW releases first images of new electric wagon concept to come to production in 2021
short_description: VW has released the first images of the new ID. SPACE VIZZION electric wagon concept that they plan to fully unveil at the LA Auto Show in two weeks.

title: Toyota signs a deal with BYD to develop batteries for electric cars
short_description: Toyota has yet to launch an all-electric vehicle, but they have been making a lot of deals to develop batteries for them and now they have one with BYD.

title: Up close with the 68 MPH Sur Ron Storm Bee electric motorcycle
short_description: The much anticipated Sur Ron Storm Bee electric motorcycle was shown off at the EICMA 2019 Milan Motorcycle Show this week.

title: Volvo starts selling electric trucks
short_description: Volvo announced that it has started selling its new electric trucks in some markets in Europe with deliveries starting next year.

title: Watch Tesla Autopilot handle a construction zone with traffic cones
short_description: A new video showing what Tesla Autopilot sees when navigating a construction zone gives an impressive look at Tesla’s evolving computer vision system.

title: Ride1Up debuts 27 MPH e-bike with higher-end specs well above its low price
short_description: Ride1Up has just launched an electric commuter bike with an impressive list of specs compared to its price. The San Diego-based company’s new Ride1Up 700 Series e-bike looks like one to keep on your radar.

title: Tesla teases some of first Model 3 made-in-China, Model Y rumored to be at Gigafactory 3
short_description: Tesla has teased some of the first Model 3 made-in-China vehicles in a few images and a Model Y prototype has been rumored to be spotted at Gigafactory 3.

title: Super Soco unveils 55 MPH electric scooter set to destroy other scooters
short_description: At a time when nearly every electric scooter company is pumping out 45 km/h (28 mph) scooters, the Super Soco CPx is going in a different direction. A faster direction. To the tune of 90 km/h (55 mph) fast.

title: EGEB: Kentucky’s new Democratic governor still backs coal, more
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):Kentucky elected Democrat Andy Beshear yesterday as their new governor. What’s his stance on green energy?Australia’s main grid reaches 50% green energy for the first time.Bristol becomes the first city in the UK to ban diesel vehicles.

title: Tesla Cybertruck pickup: What to expect — podcast
short_description: The Tesla Cybertruck pickup has an official release date now, and we take a look at what to expect on November 21 at the unveiling in this special episode of the Electrek Podcast.Support our show!https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2019/11/Electrek-11-06-2019.mp3

title: Elon Musk: Tesla will increase Model S/X battery pack capacity with new Plaid mode version
short_description: Elon Musk confirmed Tesla will release a new biggest battery pack capacity for Model S and Model X with the new Plaid mode version coming next year.

title: NIU reveals new 44 MPH electric scooters and a 28 MPH electric bicycle
short_description: NIU has an extensive line of popular electric scooters, but that hasn’t stopped the company from innovating even further.

title: Volvo implements blockchain to trace ethical sources for cobalt in EV batteries
short_description: Volvo Cars announced today that it would become the first carmaker to implement global traceability of cobalt by applying blockchain technology. The Swedish carmaker said that it reached an agreement with its two global battery suppliers, CATL of China and LG Chem of South Korea, to trace cobalt supplies starting this year.

title: Tesla ‘Cybertruck’ pickup gets unveil date: Nov 21 in LA
short_description: Elon Musk confirmed that Tesla is going to unveil the ‘Cybertruck’ on November 21 in Los Angeles “near SpaceX’s rocket factory.”

title: Review: Tower Beach Bum, Mark Cuban endorsed e-bike
short_description: The Tower Beach Bum is not only easy only the wallet (being direct-to-consumer), it’s also easy on the eyes and backside as a purposeful beach cruiser. While it’s not on the forefront of e-bike tech, it’s value proposition is compelling enough to get Mark Cuban’s stamp of approval as a key investor in Tower.

title: Tesla is planning massive service and charging expansion in China ahead of Gigafactory 3 volume
short_description: Tesla is planning a massive service, sales, and charging infrastructure expansion in China ahead of the expected increase in vehicle sales due to volume production at Gigafactory 3.

title: The key to everyday EV fast charging is software, says Qnovo CEO
short_description: The adaptive charging method offered by software maker Qnovo ensures battery health for tens of millions of smartphones. Now the company wants to bring the same algorithms to EVs. Should we stop waiting for pie-in-the-sky breakthroughs in cell chemistry or solid-state EV batteries?

title: Kia unveils sleek-looking electric SUV concept that you’ll never see on the road
short_description: Kia has unveiled a new sleek-looking electric SUV concept, but it’s unfortunately not something you are likely ever going to see on the road.

title: Tesla is updating its internal OS, will focus on securing customer accounts next, says Musk
short_description: Elon Musk announced that Tesla is making major changes to its internal corporate operating system (OS), and that the software team will focus on securing customer accounts next with two-factor authorization.

title: Tesla secures battery cell supply deal with CATL, report says
short_description: Tesla has reportedly secured a battery supply deal with CATL, China’s biggest battery manufacturer, to supply cells for Gigafactory 3 in Shanghai and potentially expand to other production facilities.

title: Kawasaki confirms electric motorcycle coming, shows off prototype in video
short_description: Ready for an electric Kawasaki Ninja? It could be here sooner than you think. Kawasaki has just announced that it is actively working on an electric motorcycle platform and even showed off a prototype in action.

title: Elon Musk pitches Tesla electric pickup truck to the US military
short_description: Elon Musk briefly talked about and sort of “pitched” the idea of the Tesla electric pickup truck, now also known as the “Tesla Cybertruck,” to the US military.

title: UBCO shows off electric utility and dirt bikes, plus portable power, in new 2020 lineup
short_description: UBCO, best known as the New Zealand-based manufacturer of the popular 2×2 electric work bike, is showing off its new 2020 line of products. Not only has UBCO expanded from its original 2×2 electric work bike into a new electric dirt/trail bike, but the company has some other interesting surprises as well.

title: Ford reveals all-electric ‘Mustang Lithium’ with 900hp at SEMA
short_description: Yesterday we were treated to a spy shot of some sort of electric Mustang under wraps at SEMA. At the time, we could tell it was at least a plug-in, but thought it must have been a plug-in hybrid.It looks like we were wrong, as today that car has been revealed as an all-electric, high-performance Mustang.

title: EGEB: Royal Dutch Shell buys a green energy company, US formally withdraws from Paris Agreement
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):Royal Dutch Shell is buying French green energy company EOLFI.Mike Pompeo announces the US’s formal withdrawal from the Paris Agreement.More than 11,000 scientists endorse a letter that warns of a global climate emergency.A quarter of Europe’s electricity needs could be met by rooftop solar, says new paper.

title: Tesla and Walmart settle dispute over the fires at solar installations
short_description: Tesla and Walmart announced that they have settled their dispute over the fires at Tesla’s solar installations at Walmart stores that led to de-energizing 240 large solar installations.

title: Beautiful electric 1969 Chevrolet Camaro debuts with new ‘plug & play’ EV conversion kit
short_description: A beautiful electric 1969 Chevrolet Camaro debuted today at SEMA as a showcase for a new “plug and play” EV conversion kit by Xing Mobility.

title: Harley-Davidson’s electric bicycles get their first public debut
short_description: Harley-Davidson hasn’t been shy when it comes to talking about its ambitious electric bicycle goals. in fact, Harley-Davidson electric bicycles are a big part of the More Roads to Harley Davidson plan.

title: KYMCO’s RevoNEX unveiled as 120 MPH electric motorcycle with 6-speed gearbox
short_description: KYMCO teased us last week about the company’s upcoming electric maxiscooter called the RevoNEX, but then pulled the best bait and switch ever. It turns out the KYMCO RevoNEX is no maxiscooter – instead, it’s an awesome high power electric motorcycle.And you’ve seriously got to see this…

title: Germany increases EV incentives – making less expensive electric cars even cheaper
short_description: Germany is increasing its incentives for buying electric vehicles with a focus on making less expensive electric cars even cheaper.

title: Segway unveils electric dirt bike as the company expands into e-powersports
short_description: Segway-Ninebot has just announced the newest electric vehicles in its product portfolio during an unveiling at the 2019 SEMA show. But these aren’t the company’s typical electric scooters. Instead, Segway-Ninebot rolled out two electric dirt bikes.

title: Tron-style electric motorcycle gets 300 km range and insane 1,000 NM torque
short_description: Verge, the Finnish electric motorcycle company formally known as RMK, wowed the crowd at EICMA 2019 with the production version of their hubless rear wheel electric motorcycle, the Verge TS.

title: Tesla is still in need of a manufacturing license in China, hopes to get it by end of the year
short_description: Tesla appears to be stuck in “trial production” at Gigafactory 3 in Shanghai as it still needs a manufacturing license to officially start production in China, according to Tesla chairman Robyn Denholm.

title: Piaggio boosts the electric Vespa’s top speed… to a whopping 70 km/h (43 mph)
short_description: The Vespa Elettrica is the first electric scooter in the Vespa family. It debuted last year with an underwhelming 45 km/h (28 mph) top speed.

title: Energica’s electric motorcycles get 60% more battery for 400 km total range
short_description: Today marks the start of EICMA 2019, the Milan Motorcycle Show. And one of the first big reveals of the show comes from Energica, the Italian electric racing motorcycle manufacturer. The company’s line of electric motorcycles saw its first major update in years today as Energica has just revealed its new 2020 models with a massive increase in battery capacity and range.

title: Tesla Model 3 Performance gets stunning street-legal racing treatment from Unplugged
short_description: While Tesla is working on a track-focused Model S, the Model 3 Performance is getting its own street-legal racing treatment from Unplugged Performance.

title: VW CEO Diess says batteries are better than hydrogen, calls for carbon price
short_description: At Volkswagen’s ceremony celebrating the start of ID.3 production, CEO Herbert Diess made several comments on the electrification of the industry. In particular, he stated that batteries, as opposed to hydrogen, are a quicker and cheaper way to reduce automotive industry emissions. He also called for a price on carbon and committed to reducing his company’s fleet carbon emissions by 30% by 2025, and to zero carbon by 2050.German Chancellor Angela Merkel also spoke at the event. She called for the German government to increase electric car incentives and set a target for the country to install a million public charging stations by 2030 to fuel 7-10 million German EVs by the same year.

title: GM unveils electric pickup hot rod concept with two Bolt EV batteries
short_description: At Sema in Las Vegas today, GM has unveiled a new electric pickup hot rod concept based on the Bolt EV. The automaker says that the concept demonstrates “electric conversion possibilities for classic vehicles, blending vintage styling and high performance with zero-emissions driving.”

title: CAKE unveils new 63 mph electric motorcycle that is a workbench on wheels
short_description: After teasing us last week, CAKE has just announced a new electric motorcycle platform known as the CAKE Ösa. The street-legal platform is designed for both on- and off-road riding and offers extreme utility with over 1,000 customization combinations.And you can be sure it looks unlike any other electric motorcycles currently on the market.

title: First drive of Polestar 1, and a chat with Polestar CEO about why it’s not a pure EV
short_description: Hardcore EV fans might easily dismiss the $156,500, limited-edition Polestar 1 as a piece of eye candy. And Polestar deserves scrutiny for debuting the electric brand with this vehicle, which has a gas engine and a battery providing a relatively modest range of about 65 miles for an EV.

title: Polestar takes EV design language to a new place
short_description: The Polestar electric performance brand is led by a chief executive who rose through industry ranks as a car designer. That’s an unusual path to the CEO’s chair. Thomas Ingenlath had lead design roles at Audi, Volkswagen, and Skoda before becoming head of design at Volvo in 2012 — and then chief executive of Polestar in 2017.

title: A plug-in Mustang? What’s Ford got under wraps at SEMA?
short_description: The auto industry is gearing up for SEMA, its annual aftermarket expo, which starts tomorrow in Las Vegas. We’ve gotten an inside photo of Ford’s stage which suggests they’re planning to reveal a plug-in electric Mustang of some sort tomorrow morning when the show opens.

title: Ford union deal confirms EV plans, electric F-150 will be built in Dearborn
short_description: Ford renegotiated its union contract last week, coming to a relatively speedy agreement between the automaker and its workers. The agreement includes a detailed breakdown of plant investments, including which cars will be made where.Of particular note, the list of cars includes two full electric vehicles (F-150 and Transit), two plug-in hybrids (Escape and Lincon Corsair), and multiple other conventional hybrids. The electric F-150 will be built alongside the standard F-150 in Ford’s main truck plant in Dearborn, Michigan, where Ford also plans to produce batteries for the electric F-150.  While the Mach E is not specifically mentioned, “Mustang derivatives” are, and it looks like that car will be built in Flat Rock, Michigan.

title: Tesla achieves record time at Nürburgring, beats Porsche Taycan, but likely still unofficial
short_description: Tesla has reportedly achieved another record time at Nürburgring race track with its Model S “Plaid” prototypes, beating the record of the Porsche Taycan, but it’s likely still unofficial.

title: EGEB: EPA’s weakened coal rules threaten waterways and public health, UK stops fracking, more
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):EPA weakens pollution rules on how power plants store coal waste and release metals into waterways.The UK puts a moratorium on fracking.New Delhi declares a health emergency due to the worst pollution in three years.The National Renewable Energy Laboratory’s new report says a US coast-to-coast transmission “super-grid” is possible.

title: Toyota Prius Prime is scarce at dealerships, leaving demand for its plug-in on the table
short_description: The Toyota Prius Prime might offer only 25 miles of electric range. And its gas engine might come on randomly and too often making its EV status debateable. But there’s no denying that the Toyota plug-in hybrid outsells every other EV and PHEV in the US except for the Tesla Model 3 (Model 3 wins there, by a factor of 7). Now there’s evidence on PriusChat.com that Toyota isn’t offering nearly enough Prius Primes to meet demand.

title: VW starts production of ID.3 electric car, converts factory to EV production
short_description: VW has officially started production of the ID.3, its first electric car on the new MEB platform, and it marks the start of the conversion of its massive Zwickau factory from gasoline-powered car production to EV production.

title: Infiniti plans all-electric SUV while rehashing idea for ‘gas-powered’ EVs
short_description: After promising an Infiniti electric car for nearly a decade, Infiniti unveiled plans last week for three new battery-powered models in the next few years. The vague plans prominently feature a technical design that Infiniti and its parent brand, Nissan, describe as an EV. But the so-called e-Power vehicles don’t offer a way to plug in.

title: This 3 kW vintage-style electric moped has nailed the classic look
short_description: The Tremel Zimmner from Germany’s Tremel Engineering is a retro-inspired electric moped.Its vintage feel is all the more impressive considering that it was designed and built by a 23 year old.

title: Tesla Model Y prototype spotted with unreleased Model 3 unveil wheels
short_description: Another Tesla Model Y prototype has been spotted and this time it was equipped with the unreleased old turbine wheels from Model 3 unveiling in 2016.

title: Swagtron unveils two new low cost electric scooters for $199 and $399
short_description: Swagtron is back (again) with another product announcement this week. This time the company is rolling out two new electric scooters with bargain prices. Check out the new Swagtron Swagger 7 and Swagger 8 electric scooters below.

title: Tesla updates driving visualization to detect traffic cones
short_description: Tesla has again updated its driving visualizations powered by Autopilot to detect construction cones and plan around them.

title: The Beast 2.0 e-bike is the monster truck of electric bicycles
short_description: Whoever said “everything in moderation” obviously never took a ride on the new Daymak Beast 2.0 e-bike. There’s nothing moderate about this ridiculous yet awesome display of a monster electric bicycle – emphasis on the “electric” and a mere passing nod to the “bicycle”.

title: The FCA-PSA merger could create an electric-vehicle powerhouse, under Carlos Tavares
short_description: This week’s announcement of a 50-50 merger between the PSA Groupe and Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCA) could create the world’s fourth-largest automaker. A big winner in the marriage is vehicle electrification.

title: Climate Crisis Weekly: Why more California wildfires? Elon becomes ‘Treelon,’ Greta Thunberg says no thanks, more
short_description: Three reasons why wildfires are still ravaging California’s environment, despite the end of the drought.What’s an energy vampire, and how can you slay it?Greta Thunberg declines the Nordic Council’s 2019 environmental prize.Tesla CEO Elon Musk pays for 1 million trees to be planted.Big hotel chains are working to source their fish more sustainably.And more…

title: More electric mopeds take the US by storm as Texas welcomes Revel moped-share
short_description: Revel’s electric moped sharing program has been on a roll with expansion across the US. The latest city to get the fast little EVs is Austin, Texas, which was helped by new electric moped friendly legislation.

title: EGEB: Keystone oil spill in North Dakota, US green energy grows by 6.15% to date, more
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):The Keystone oil pipeline has spilled around 383,000 gallons of tar sands oil in North Dakota.Non-hydro green energy grew in the US by 6.15% compared to 2018.Credit Suisse senior banker says investments could ‘go to zero quickly’ if companies ignore climate change.Gov. Mike Dunleavy (R-AK) and Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-NY) have Twitter “words” over the Green New Deal.

title: Tesla increases range and price of the Model 3 Long Range
short_description: Tesla has updated its Model 3 online configurator today to increase the rated-range and price of the Model 3 Long Range.

title: Podcast: Tesla Model S vs Porsche Taycan, new Model X seats, Mini Cooper electric, and more
short_description: This week on the Electrek Podcast, we discuss the most popular news in the world of sustainable transport and energy, including increasing Tesla Model S vs Porsche Taycan comparison, new Model X seats, the Mini Cooper electric’s price, and more.https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2019/11/Electrek-11-01-2019.mp3

title: Fisker and Canoo offered only in monthly subscriptions, raising doubts
short_description: EV fans are accustomed to Henrik Fisker making plans for ground-breaking electric vehicles. We want Mr. Fisker to succeed. But there’s a telltale sign that the economic fundamentals of his new EV aren’t quite worked out: It’s offered only “in a flexible lease,” a scheme commonly described as a car subscription.

title: Here’s all the coolest electric motorcycles headed to the Milan Motorcycle Show
short_description: EICMA 2019, or the Milan Motorcycle Show, begins on Tuesday, November 5th. EICMA is the biggest international motorcycle trade show of the year and is where most companies choose to make their new motorcycle announcements. Last year saw an impressive showing of electric motorcycles, and this year is already shaping up to be even bigger.Here we’ve compiled a complete rundown of every electric motorcycle company that we are expecting big news or product unveilings from.

title: Tesla Solar Roof glass wins against pumpkin, but questions about longevity remain
short_description: Elon Musk released a video of someone throwing a pumpkin at Tesla Solar Roof V3 glass and the “Solarglass” won, but questions about the longevity of the product remain.

title: EGEB: Trump administration sued over CA drilling plan, young Americans willing to pay more for green energy, more
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):Environmental groups are suing the Trump administration over a California oil and gas drilling plan.47% of Americans are willing to pay more for green energy.Germany’s carbon dioxide emissions fall in 2019 as energy use declines.

title: CAKE prepares to release new ‘highly modular’ electric motorbike, teases pics
short_description: Swedish electric motorcycle CAKE will be taking to the 2019 EICMA Milan Motorcycle Show next week to unveil a new electric motorbike known as the Ösa. And now we’re getting some new teaser photos that hint at what kind of motorbike we’re possibly looking at.

title: Tesla is increasing Model S peak power by 50hp through software, Musk says will beat Porsche Taycan
short_description: Tesla’s upcoming power increase through software update is going to add 50 horsepower to the Model S’ peak output, according to CEO Elon Musk who says that the Model S Raven will now beat the Porsche Taycan Turbo S on the quarter-mile.

title: Gogoro’s swappable batteries scooped up in Suzuki partner’s new e-scooters
short_description: Gogoro swappable batteries designed for electric scooters appear to be marching toward becoming a de facto standard. The company just reached out with a new announcement that Tai Ling, a long time Suzuki partner, is launching a new electric scooter brand with Gogoro’s swappable batteries as its power source.

title: Mercedes-Benz recalls EQC electric SUV over a problem that could block transmission
short_description: Mercedes-Benz is running into some issues with its first electric SUV, the EQC, as it issued a recall over a problem that could block the transmission.

title: Fisker releases more images of its affordable electric SUV, calls it ‘Ocean’
short_description: Fisker has released more images of its upcoming electric SUV, which he claims will be “affordable,” and he announced the name: Ocean.

title: Review: The Swytch is the weirdest little e-bike conversion kit that I actually love
short_description: I’ve seen and played around with a lot of DIY electric bicycle conversion kits. Hell, I even wrote the book on the subject. But the Swytch kit is something unlike any other conversion kit I’ve seen. It’s an interesting new take on the classic e-bike conversion problem.

title: Tesla Gigafactory 1 battery cell production ramping up, but efficiency improvement delayed, says Panasonic
short_description: Tesla Gigafactory 1 battery cell production is “quickly ramping up,” according to Panasonic, but some production efficiency improvements have been “delayed.”

title: Elon Musk’s funniest moments from his deposition over Tesla’s SolarCity acquisition
short_description: Tesla and Elon Musk are currently being sued by shareholders over the SolarCity acquisition and Musk was deposed, which created some very funny moments.

title: Toyota’s greenwashing conceals worsening fleet MPG, shows why they oppose MPG standards
short_description: Toyota, GM, and FCA have been getting a lot of flack the last couple days, in response to their move to join the EPA in opposing better MPG standards against the interests of consumers and the environment.Toyota responded to this public outcry by claiming that it wants “continuous, year-over-year improvements in fuel economy,” but there’s one problem with that: Their fleet average MPG is actually getting worse over time, unlike every other automaker.

title: Tesla Model Y spotted driving side by side with Model 3, other cars in best size comparison yet
short_description: With the Tesla Model Y slated to hit the road next summer, we’re getting more and more sightings of prototypes out and about.  Most of these sightings are around Tesla’s Palo Alto, California, headquarters, though we’ve seen the car as far away as Washington State and Michigan.Thanks to Tesla’s dashcam feature, we’ve now got a three-minute-long video of the Model Y driving in San Jose. Better yet, for much of the drive it’s side by side with a Model 3, demonstrating an excellent comparison between the two vehicles.

title: Check out these Ford ‘Mustang-inspired’ electric SUV renders based on leaked CAD files
short_description: Ford is getting ready to unveil its “Mustang-inspired” Tesla Model Y competitor on November 17, and so far, the only official media we have on the electric SUV is a silhouette.  But a fan forum has produced a render of the upcoming car, rumored to be named the Mach E, based on leaked CAD drawings, which shows a possible form that it might take.

title: EGEB: Rex Tillerson testifies at Exxon trial, Elon Musk donates 1M trees, more
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):Former US Secretary of State Rex Tillerson testifies at Exxon trial.Elon Musk donates $1 million to tree planting project.Big battery investments are dropping costs faster than anticipated.

title: Nissan has a dual motor AWD electric Leaf, but you can’t buy it
short_description: Nissan has unveiled a dual-motor AWD version of its all-electric Leaf, but the automaker is not making it available for sale.

title: First look at the new 2020 Energica Ego electric motorcycle
short_description: It looks like we can add Energica to the list of electric motorcycle companies that will be pulling a veil off a shiny new motorcycle at the 2019 EICMA Milan Motorcycle Show next week. The Italian electric motorcycle manufacturer will be showing off the 2020 version of its flagship Energica Ego electric racing bike.

title: Review: Alizeti 300c friction drive e-bike actually works
short_description: If you’ve never heard of a friction drive electric bike system, there’s a good reason. Past systems have been described as “gutless,” “incomplete,” and “useless in the rain.” With this condemning backdrop, a small company from Quebec has shattered expectations with the feature-rich 300c from Alizeti.

title: VW teases a new ID electric concept to be unveiled in the US
short_description: VW has released a teaser image of a new ID electric concept to be unveiled in the US next month.

title: Elon ‘Treelon’ Musk donates 1 million trees to #teamtrees YouTube project
short_description: Elon Musk announced on Twitter late yesterday afternoon that he’d donate 1 million trees to the #teamtrees project launched by YouTube star MrBeast. He then changed his Twitter name to “Treelon” Musk.

title: Tesla Model S ‘Raven’ put against Porsche Taycan Turbo S in fairer review — both are great
short_description: We previously reported on a direct comparison between the Tesla Model S and the new Porsche Taycan, but the review had its issues.Now a Tesla Model S ‘Raven’ vs Porsche Taycan Turbo S gives a fairer look at the two top-of-the-line electric sedans and it concludes both are great cars.

title: Company behind ‘first American-style cruiser electric motorcycle’ lifts the veil
short_description: This past weekend we first broke the news on a new electric motorcycle that was headed for a debut at the 2019 EICMA Milan Motorcycle Show next month. But as interesting as the Hadin Panther electric cruiser looked, there were some serious questions and suspicious riddles that were left unanswered.Now we’ve caught up with the company to get to the bottom of the mystery of what they call the “first American-style cruiser electric motorcycle.”

title: Tesla is being sued in Germany for allegedly false advertising on Autopilot
short_description: Tesla is facing an injunction by a consumer protection agency in Germany over what they believe are false claims about the capabilities of its Autopilot and “Full Self-Driving” packages.

title: The ridiculously fun WideWheel electric scooter is back with upgraded brakes
short_description: One of our favorite electric scooters of the year has been the WideWheel electric scooter from FluidFreeRide.

title: Elon Musk warns of Tesla Self-Driving price increase as they sit on half a billion in unrecognized revenue
short_description: Elon Musk warns that Tesla is about to increase the price of its “Full Self-Driving” package as the company now sits on around half a billion in unrecognized revenue from the unreleased feature.

title: EGEB: Murray Energy goes bankrupt as coal’s canary gasps its dying breath, more
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):The largest private coal company in the US, owned by Robert Murray (above), has filed for bankruptcy.Could saltwater and rust be the latest source of green energy?Which US metro areas have the most solar panels on homes?The Bureau of Land Management approved what will become the largest wind farm in the US.

title: Tesla Model 3 prototypes with potentially longer wheelbase spotted
short_description: Some Tesla Model 3 prototypes with a potentially longer wheelbase have been spotted in China – starting a rumor that Tesla could offer it as an option.

title: Vintage Electric rolls out 36 MPH electric bicycle in Shelby Cobra edition
short_description: Vintage Electric, a California-based electric bike manufacturer, collaborated with American automotive racing legend Carrol Shelby’s grandson on Vintage’s latest high-speed electric bicycle.

title: Tesla Model 3 becomes first electric car approved as NYC yellow cab
